rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTSPID

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTTESTCD

datasetVariables.description:
Short character value for FTTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FTTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
Controlled terminology for FTTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for FTTESTCD. Examples: "W250101", "W25F0102".
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Test
datasetVariables.name: FTTESTCD

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTTEST

datasetVariables.description:
Verbatim name of the question used to obtain the finding. The value in FTTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
Controlled terminology for FTTEST is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for FTTEST. Examples: "W2501-25 Foot Walk Time", "W25F-More Than Two Attempts".
datasetVariables.label: Name of Test
datasetVariables.name: FTTEST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTSTRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FTORRES in a standard format or in standard units. FTSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FTSTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
datasetVariables.name: FTSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FTSTRESC. FTSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: FTSTRESN

datasetVariables.label: Standard Units

datasetVariables.name: FTSTAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Used in conjunction with FTSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

datasetVariables.name: FTREASND

datasetVariables.name: FTLOBXFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as FTLOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FTBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: FTBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: FTDRVFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: FTEVAL

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTREPNUM

datasetVariables.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.
datasetVariables.label: Repetition Number
datasetVariables.name: FTREPNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTTPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See FTTPTNUM and FTTPTREF.

datasetVariables.name: FTTPT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable FT.FTELTM

datasetVariables.name: FTELTM

description: A findings domain that contains data for named, stand-alone, task-based evaluations designed to provide an assessment of mobility, dexterity, or cognitive ability. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C117756, 2018-06-29)
label: Functional Tests
name: FT
